metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16536 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
The cx231xx_usb_probe function in drivers/media/usb/cx231xx/cx231xx-cards.cin the Linux kernel through 4.13.11 allows local users to cause a denial ofservice (NULL pointer dereference and system crash) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via a crafted USB device.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16536` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-10.11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1006-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1006.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1143-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-oem - 4.15.0-1002.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-10.11').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1006.7').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
linux-oem package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.3').
